freuds-communications.name: Matthew Freud
freuds-communications.bio: Great-grandson of Sigmund Freud who founded Freuds in 1986, building it into one of the UK's most prominent PR and communications firms.

freuds-communications.name: Arlo Brady
freuds-communications.bio: CEO of Freuds who has overseen the agency's expansion into purpose-driven communications and brand strategy.

freuds-communications.name: Jo Casey
freuds-communications.bio: Senior leader at Freuds with extensive experience in consumer and corporate communications campaigns.

leo-baeck-college.name: Werner van der Zyl
leo-baeck-college.bio: Rabbi who co-founded Leo Baeck College in 1956 to train rabbis for Progressive Judaism in Europe.

leo-baeck-college.name: Deborah Kahn-Harris
leo-baeck-college.bio: Served as Principal of Leo Baeck College, leading the institution's rabbinical and educational programs.

leo-baeck-college.name: Jonathan Magonet
leo-baeck-college.bio: Bible scholar who served as Principal of Leo Baeck College for many years, shaping Progressive rabbinical training in Britain.

leo-baeck-college.name: Marc Sheridan
leo-baeck-college.bio: Community leader who chaired the governing body overseeing Leo Baeck College's academic and strategic direction.

jewish-chronicle.name: Jake Wallis Simons
jewish-chronicle.bio: Journalist and author who became editor of the Jewish Chronicle, the world's oldest continuously published Jewish newspaper.

jewish-chronicle.name: Stephen Pollard
jewish-chronicle.bio: Prominent journalist who edited the Jewish Chronicle from 2008 to 2023, significantly expanding its digital presence and political influence.

jewish-chronicle.name: Leopold Greenberg
jewish-chronicle.bio: Zionist activist who owned and edited the Jewish Chronicle in the early 20th century, aligning it closely with the Zionist movement.

jewish-chronicle.name: Robbie Gibb
jewish-chronicle.bio: Former BBC and Downing Street communications director who joined the Jewish Chronicle's board.

institute-for-jewish-policy-research-jpr.name: Jonathan Boyd
institute-for-jewish-policy-research-jpr.bio: Leading scholar of European Jewish demography who has directed JPR's research agenda on Jewish community life since 2010.

institute-for-jewish-policy-research-jpr.name: Daniel Staetsky
institute-for-jewish-policy-research-jpr.bio: Demographer and statistician who leads JPR's quantitative research on Jewish populations across Europe.

institute-for-jewish-policy-research-jpr.name: Stanley Kalms
institute-for-jewish-policy-research-jpr.bio: Businessman and life peer who chaired JPR, supporting its mission to inform Jewish communal policy through research.

institute-for-jewish-policy-research-jpr.name: Antony Lerman
institute-for-jewish-policy-research-jpr.bio: Writer and policy specialist who directed the Institute for Jewish Policy Research and shaped its early research programs.

jewish-museum-london.name: Abigail Morris
jewish-museum-london.bio: Museum professional who served as director of the Jewish Museum London, overseeing its exhibitions and community engagement programs.

jewish-museum-london.name: Alfred Rubens
jewish-museum-london.bio: Historian and collector whose donations of Jewish art and artifacts helped establish the Jewish Museum London in 1932.

jewish-museum-london.name: Rachel Kolsky
jewish-museum-london.bio: Historian and educator who developed the museum's public programs exploring British Jewish heritage.

entain-formerly-gvc-holdings.name: Jette Nygaard-Andersen
entain-formerly-gvc-holdings.bio: Danish businesswoman who served as CEO of Entain, overseeing its portfolio of major gambling brands including Ladbrokes and Coral.

entain-formerly-gvc-holdings.name: Gavin Isaacs
entain-formerly-gvc-holdings.bio: South African executive who led the transformation of GVC Holdings into a major global sports betting and gaming company.

entain-formerly-gvc-holdings.name: Barry Gibson
entain-formerly-gvc-holdings.bio: Experienced chairman who led Entain's board through its rebranding from GVC Holdings and major strategic acquisitions.

entain-formerly-gvc-holdings.name: Shay Segev
entain-formerly-gvc-holdings.bio: Israeli-born technology executive who served as Entain CEO before departing to lead DAZN Group.

limmud.name: Clive Lawton
limmud.bio: Educator and communal leader who co-founded Limmud in 1980, creating a model of cross-communal Jewish learning that spread worldwide.

limmud.name: Michael Wegier
limmud.bio: Community organizer who chaired Limmud and helped expand its volunteer-driven educational conferences across multiple countries.

limmud.name: Raymond Simonson
limmud.bio: Communal professional and longtime Limmud volunteer who helped shape its ethos of participatory Jewish education.

union-of-jewish-students-ujs.name: Edward Isaacs
union-of-jewish-students-ujs.bio: Student leader who served as president of UJS, representing Jewish students across UK and Irish university campuses.

union-of-jewish-students-ujs.name: Joel Sheridan
union-of-jewish-students-ujs.bio: Student activist who led UJS campaigns on antisemitism and welfare issues facing Jewish students on campus.

union-of-jewish-students-ujs.name: Hannah Rose
union-of-jewish-students-ujs.bio: Former UJS president who advocated for Jewish student welfare and combated antisemitism in higher education.

jews-college-heythrop-association.name: Michael Friedlander
jews-college-heythrop-association.bio: German-born scholar who served as principal of Jews' College for over 40 years from 1865, shaping Orthodox rabbinical training in Britain.

jews-college-heythrop-association.name: Isidore Epstein
jews-college-heythrop-association.bio: Talmudic scholar and principal of Jews' College best known for editing the Soncino English translation of the Babylonian Talmud.

jews-college-heythrop-association.name: Adolph BÃ¼chler
jews-college-heythrop-association.bio: Hungarian-born historian who served as principal of Jews' College from 1906 and was a noted scholar of Second Temple Judaism.

jews-college-heythrop-association.name: Abraham Levy
jews-college-heythrop-association.bio: Rabbi of the Spanish and Portuguese Jews' Congregation and Jews' College alumnus known for his broadcasting and communal leadership.

jews-free-school-jfs.name: Rachel Fink
jews-free-school-jfs.bio: Educator who served as headteacher of JFS, one of the largest Jewish secondary schools in Europe, based in Harrow.

jews-free-school-jfs.name: Moses Angel
jews-free-school-jfs.bio: Pioneering Victorian educator who served as headmaster of the Jews' Free School for over 50 years in the 19th century.

jews-free-school-jfs.name: Ruth Robins
jews-free-school-jfs.bio: Community leader who chaired the governing body of JFS, guiding the school through its relocation from Camden to Kenton.

london-school-of-jewish-studies-lsjs.name: Raphael Zarum
london-school-of-jewish-studies-lsjs.bio: Physicist-turned-rabbi who serves as Dean of LSJS, modernizing Jewish adult education and teacher training in the UK.

london-school-of-jewish-studies-lsjs.name: Naftali Brawer
london-school-of-jewish-studies-lsjs.bio: Rabbi and social entrepreneur who served as CEO of LSJS, expanding its community education programs.

london-school-of-jewish-studies-lsjs.name: Isidore Epstein
london-school-of-jewish-studies-lsjs.bio: Renowned Talmudist who led the institution in its earlier incarnation as Jews' College, overseeing decades of Orthodox scholarship.

wpp-plc.name: Martin Sorrell
wpp-plc.bio: British businessman who built WPP from a shell company into the world's largest advertising and communications group over three decades.

wpp-plc.name: Mark Read
wpp-plc.bio: Technology-focused executive who succeeded Martin Sorrell as CEO of WPP, leading its transformation toward digital marketing services.

wpp-plc.name: Roberto Quarta
wpp-plc.bio: Italian-American businessman who chairs WPP's board, previously serving as chairman of Smith & Nephew and BBA Aviation.

wpp-plc.name: John Rogers
wpp-plc.bio: Former CFO of J Sainsbury who joined WPP as COO oversee finance, IT, procurement and property operations.

uk-jewish-film-festival.name: Judy Ironside
uk-jewish-film-festival.bio: Film professional who founded the UK Jewish Film Festival to showcase Jewish-themed cinema from around the world.

uk-jewish-film-festival.name: Michael Etherton
uk-jewish-film-festival.bio: Arts administrator who directed programming and operations for the UK Jewish Film Festival's annual London screenings.

uk-jewish-film-festival.name: Lisa Sheridan
uk-jewish-film-festival.bio: Community leader and film enthusiast who chaired the festival's board, supporting its mission of cultural engagement through cinema.

jewish-news.name: Richard Ferrer
jewish-news.bio: Journalist who serves as editor of the Jewish News, one of the UK's leading Jewish community newspapers.

jewish-news.name: Justin Cohen
jewish-news.bio: Veteran journalist and senior reporter at the Jewish News known for in-depth coverage of British Jewish communal affairs.

jewish-news.name: Simon Rothstein
jewish-news.bio: Media professional who contributed to shaping the Jewish News as a key voice in British Jewish journalism.

reuters-thompson-reuters.name: Paul Reuter
reuters-thompson-reuters.bio: German-born entrepreneur who founded Reuters news agency in 1851, pioneering the use of telegraph technology for international news transmission.

reuters-thompson-reuters.name: David Thomson
reuters-thompson-reuters.bio: Canadian billionaire and chairman of Thomson Reuters whose family trust controls the majority of the company's shares.

reuters-thompson-reuters.name: Steve Hasker
reuters-thompson-reuters.bio: Australian executive serving as CEO of Thomson Reuters, leading its transformation into a global information services and data analytics company.

reuters-thompson-reuters.name: Jim Smith
reuters-thompson-reuters.bio: American executive who served as CEO of Thomson Reuters and oversaw key divestitures and strategic pivots toward financial data services.

shell-royal-dutch-shell.name: Marcus Samuel
shell-royal-dutch-shell.bio: Jewish entrepreneur and Lord Mayor of London who founded Shell Transport and Trading Company in 1897, building a global oil empire.

shell-royal-dutch-shell.name: Wael Sawan
shell-royal-dutch-shell.bio: Lebanese-born British engineer who became CEO of Shell in 2023, steering the energy giant's transition strategy.

shell-royal-dutch-shell.name: Ben van Beurden
shell-royal-dutch-shell.bio: Dutch executive who led Shell through its unification of dual-listed structure and oversaw major energy transition commitments.

shell-royal-dutch-shell.name: Andrew Mackenzie
shell-royal-dutch-shell.bio: Former BHP CEO who became chairman of Shell, guiding the company's board through the energy transition era.

holocaust-educational-trust.name: Karen Pollock
holocaust-educational-trust.bio: Longtime chief executive of the Holocaust Educational Trust who has led its mission to educate young people about the Holocaust across the UK.

holocaust-educational-trust.name: Greville Janner
holocaust-educational-trust.bio: Labour politician and barrister who founded the Holocaust Educational Trust in 1988 to promote Holocaust education in British schools.

holocaust-educational-trust.name: Ruth Mandel
holocaust-educational-trust.bio: Community leader and trustee who supported the Holocaust Educational Trust's outreach and fundraising efforts.

holocaust-educational-trust.name: Alex Sheridan
holocaust-educational-trust.bio: Educator who leads the Trust's flagship Lessons from Auschwitz programme, taking thousands of students to visit the former concentration camp each year.

glaxosmithkline-gsk.name: Emma Walmsley
glaxosmithkline-gsk.bio: First woman to lead a major pharmaceutical company, serving as CEO of GSK and overseeing its demerger of the consumer health division.

glaxosmithkline-gsk.name: Jonathan Symonds
glaxosmithkline-gsk.bio: Chartered accountant who chairs GSK's board, bringing extensive experience in pharmaceutical and financial leadership.

glaxosmithkline-gsk.name: Hal Barron
glaxosmithkline-gsk.bio: American physician-scientist who served as GSK's Chief Scientific Officer, reshaping the company's R&D pipeline with a focus on genetics.

glaxosmithkline-gsk.name: Andrew Witty
glaxosmithkline-gsk.bio: British executive who led GSK for nearly a decade before becoming CEO of UnitedHealth Group, expanding access to medicines in developing nations.

man-group.name: Robyn Grew
man-group.bio: First woman to lead Man Group, taking over as CEO of the world's largest publicly listed hedge fund manager.

man-group.name: Luke Ellis
man-group.bio: Seasoned investment professional who led Man Group as CEO, expanding its quantitative and systematic investment strategies.

man-group.name: John Cryan
man-group.bio: Former Deutsche Bank CEO who chairs Man Group's board, bringing deep financial services governance experience.

man-group.name: Sandy Rattray
man-group.bio: Investment strategist who served as Man Group's CIO, known for his work on trend-following and systematic trading strategies.

liberal-judaism.name: Lily Montagu
liberal-judaism.bio: Pioneer of Liberal Judaism in the UK who co-founded the Jewish Religious Union in 1902 and championed women's spiritual leadership.

liberal-judaism.name: Claude Montefiore
liberal-judaism.bio: Biblical scholar and philanthropist who co-founded Liberal Judaism in Britain, advocating for a modernized approach to Jewish theology.

liberal-judaism.name: Charley Baginsky
liberal-judaism.bio: Communal professional serving as CEO of Liberal Judaism, overseeing its network of synagogues and community programs across the UK.

liberal-judaism.name: Alexandra Wright
liberal-judaism.bio: First woman to serve as senior rabbi of the Liberal Jewish Synagogue in London, a leading figure in British Liberal Judaism.

united-jewish-israel-appeal.name: Mandy Tisch
united-jewish-israel-appeal.bio: Communal leader who chairs UJIA, overseeing its mission to strengthen connections between British Jews and Israel.

united-jewish-israel-appeal.name: David Cohen
united-jewish-israel-appeal.bio: Executive who leads UJIA's programs supporting young people's engagement with Israel and Jewish identity in the UK.

united-jewish-israel-appeal.name: Michael Goldstein
united-jewish-israel-appeal.bio: Prominent community figure who chaired UJIA, guiding fundraising and programmatic efforts for UK-Israel engagement.

arm-holdings.name: Rene Haas
arm-holdings.bio: American semiconductor executive serving as CEO of ARM Holdings, leading the company through its return to public markets.

arm-holdings.name: Simon Segars
arm-holdings.bio: British engineer who served as CEO of ARM Holdings, overseeing its acquisition by SoftBank and continued expansion in mobile and IoT chip design.

arm-holdings.name: Hermann Hauser
arm-holdings.bio: Austrian-born entrepreneur who co-founded Acorn Computers, from which ARM was spun out as a joint venture in 1990.

arm-holdings.name: Masayoshi Son
arm-holdings.bio: Japanese billionaire founder of SoftBank who acquired ARM Holdings in 2016 for $32 billion, calling it his most important investment ever.

marks-spencer-m-s.name: Michael Marks
marks-spencer-m-s.bio: Belarusian-born Jewish immigrant who co-founded Marks & Spencer in 1884 with his Penny Bazaar market stall in Leeds.

marks-spencer-m-s.name: Simon Marks
marks-spencer-m-s.bio: Son of founder Michael Marks who transformed M&S into Britain's leading retailer as chairman, pioneering quality and branding standards.

marks-spencer-m-s.name: Stuart Machin
marks-spencer-m-s.bio: Retail executive serving as CEO of Marks & Spencer, leading the company's turnaround strategy focused on food and clothing.

marks-spencer-m-s.name: Archie Norman
marks-spencer-m-s.bio: Former Conservative MP and business turnaround specialist who chairs M&S, driving its modernization and digital transformation.
